content: The Neo-Conservative voters that re-elected the Republican Party - which has been specializing in getting everything AFU in the first place shouldn't be pointing a finger at anyone. What you all need to do is look in the mirror and ask yourself a few questions: 1. Did you vote for the Republican Party because Rush Limbaugh or Glenn Beck told you to? 2. When Ronald Reagan took a $700 billion dollar deficit and turned it into $3 Trillion dollars years ago, what the hell made you guys think you were on the "right track"? 3. While you were either afraid to be an individual or give a different opinion at work - or trying to make others feel uncomfortable because they had a different point of view; how did you manage to look in the mirror and still feel that you weren't part of the problem? Yeah... Sure... Whatever... Now take responsibility and apologize for the past 2 decades - because when all is said and done, you all are the ones who made it possible. Thanks guys... Good job!

content: Some interesting information on the Nat. Debt here: ""http://www.brillig.com/debt_clock/faq.html Now, remember please, that the PRESIDENT proposes and the CONGRESS disposes. The CONGRESS ultimately delevers a budget bill to the President, and , very very infrequently do the Presidents veto , pocket veto, or refuse to sign. The Obama admin.'s economics will result in at least doubeling the debt. Hope you noticed that at the G-20 Mr. Obama has committed America to another TRILLION DOLLARS of payments/spending to the "third world"! BTW, my one beef with Reagan was his decision to sign the budget bills. My beef with the Rep. Congress was and remains the excessive "entitlement" expendatures.

content: quote: Originally posted by boazjones: The Neo-Conservative voters that re-elected the Republican Party - which has been specializing in getting everything AFU in the first place shouldn't be pointing a finger at anyone. Yeah, everything went sooooo well the 40+ years the democrats controlled congress. What you all need to do is look in the mirror and ask yourself a few questions: 1. Did you vote for the Republican Party because Rush Limbaugh or Glenn Beck told you to? Nope - do not listen to either of them. Was voting republican way before Rush got a national microphone. I supported a democrat once (Carter). Learned my lesson. 2. When Ronald Reagan took a $700 billion dollar deficit and turned it into $3 Trillion dollars years ago, what the hell made you guys think you were on the "right track"? Considering some of that was used to push the USSR over the edge earlier than they would have fallen, money well spent. And it seems to me Reagan was dealing with a democratic congress for most of his 8 years. IIRC they had a hand in it also. 3. While you were either afraid to be an individual or give a different opinion at work - or trying to make others feel uncomfortable because they had a different point of view; how did you manage to look in the mirror and still feel that you weren't part of the problem? How do you? Yeah... Sure... Whatever... Now take responsibility and apologize for the past 2 decades - because when all is said and done, you all are the ones who made it possible. Thanks guys... Good job!
quote: Originally posted by boazjones: The Neo-Conservative voters that re-elected the Republican Party - which has been specializing in getting everything AFU in the first place shouldn't be pointing a finger at anyone. Yeah, everything went sooooo well the 40+ years the democrats controlled congress. What you all need to do is look in the mirror and ask yourself a few questions: 1. Did you vote for the Republican Party because Rush Limbaugh or Glenn Beck told you to? Nope - do not listen to either of them. Was voting republican way before Rush got a national microphone. I supported a democrat once (Carter). Learned my lesson. 2. When Ronald Reagan took a $700 billion dollar deficit and turned it into $3 Trillion dollars years ago, what the hell made you guys think you were on the "right track"? Considering some of that was used to push the USSR over the edge earlier than they would have fallen, money well spent. And it seems to me Reagan was dealing with a democratic congress for most of his 8 years. IIRC they had a hand in it also. 3. While you were either afraid to be an individual or give a different opinion at work - or trying to make others feel uncomfortable because they had a different point of view; how did you manage to look in the mirror and still feel that you weren't part of the problem? How do you? Yeah... Sure... Whatever... Now take responsibility and apologize for the past 2 decades - because when all is said and done, you all are the ones who made it possible. Thanks guys... Good job!
title: This Administration Reminds Me Of.......

content: quote: Originally posted by Tangler: quote: Originally posted by adminnco1: quote: Originally posted by boazjones: Actually, Neo-Conservative Voters like yourselves deserve all the credit. It is a simple fact of history: through "Voodoo Economics" and "Trickle Down Theory", the Republicans have been laying down the groundwork of the possible collapse of this economy for 20 years. In fact, Republicans are so good at destroying this economy - one has to wonder are you all doing it on purpose? Given the current economic situation and the direction the new administration is clearly heading what happens when a substantial number of those making up the target 5% decide John Galt had the correct idea? Of greater importance, once they "go Galt" who will the government then decide to tax? Funny, have seen a large group of rich people coming here from many other high tax countries, but I don't see the same people heading out to a lower tax haven...except for the criminals. I also note that the people most screaming about the taxs don't qualify for the 5%. I have no particular affection for the 5% but do understand the appeal of a cash and carry business. Many in the lower end of that category can with creative accounting and consistent cash transactions no doubt reduce their tax liablity. To think otherwise flies in the face of any and all logic. Considering the vastness of the programs being developed by the new administration the money for their development and maintenance will need to come from somewhere and if the targetted 5% don't deliver someone else will be called upon to do so. Since late last summer I have firmly believed the main groups that will benefit from the new administration will be tax lawyers and accountants.
quote: Originally posted by Tangler: quote: Originally posted by adminnco1: quote: Originally posted by boazjones: Actually, Neo-Conservative Voters like yourselves deserve all the credit. It is a simple fact of history: through "Voodoo Economics" and "Trickle Down Theory", the Republicans have been laying down the groundwork of the possible collapse of this economy for 20 years. In fact, Republicans are so good at destroying this economy - one has to wonder are you all doing it on purpose? Given the current economic situation and the direction the new administration is clearly heading what happens when a substantial number of those making up the target 5% decide John Galt had the correct idea? Of greater importance, once they "go Galt" who will the government then decide to tax? Funny, have seen a large group of rich people coming here from many other high tax countries, but I don't see the same people heading out to a lower tax haven...except for the criminals. I also note that the people most screaming about the taxs don't qualify for the 5%.
reply: I have no particular affection for the 5% but do understand the appeal of a cash and carry business. Many in the lower end of that category can with creative accounting and consistent cash transactions no doubt reduce their tax liablity. To think otherwise flies in the face of any and all logic. Considering the vastness of the programs being developed by the new administration the money for their development and maintenance will need to come from somewhere and if the targetted 5% don't deliver someone else will be called upon to do so. Since late last summer I have firmly believed the main groups that will benefit from the new administration will be tax lawyers and accountants.
title: This Administration Reminds Me Of.......
